results.title: Better safe than sorry. - Revised edition
results.brief_description: Depicts situations that children could encounter with strangers, as well as with known adults, that involve physical and sexual abuse and shows children how to deal with these potential situations. Stresses that children are in no way to blame for the deviant behaviour of adults and should not feel guilty about their involvement in these situations. Presents three rules for children to follow: say no; get away; tell someone.

results.title: Hope is not a method (2nd revision)
results.creator_credit: Planned Parenthood Center of Syracuse and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Cites and describes nine contraceptive methods with anatomically explicit diagrams. States the advantages of withdrawal, rhythm, spermicidal chemicals, the cap, the condom, the diaphragm, the pill, the IUD and sterilization.

results.title: Beyond the frozen edge
results.brief_description: A compilation of 10 four minute programmes based on a 6 week trip by Rob Gell on the Antarctic supply vessel “Icebird” to the Australian Scientific Research Stations in Antarctica.

results.title: Senior Campus
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: In panel interviews, staff, students and parents of two schools, Bendigo Senior High and Kurani College, Morwell, discuss issues related to planning, developing and running of a senior campus and a school complex with a senior campus.

results.title: Return to Botany Bay
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Intersperses 1987 documentary footage of the re-enactment of the voyage of the First Fleet with Trevor Lunn interviewing an Australia Post representative discussing their role in the Bi-centennial re-enactment and production of the commemorative stamp series.

results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and TV Ed Productions

results.title: Gold fever
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: They came to get rich quickly and escape poverty in their homelands, but what they found was not always wealth. This program looks at life on the goldfields and discusses some of the problems that the diggers encountered. Sovereign Hill at Ballarat is featured.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, George Cass, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.title: Nature printing
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Kerrie Aulsebrook, an Education Officer at the Museum of Victoria, looks at the techniques of nature printing. Nature printing is transferring the image of something in nature, (such as fish, plants, feathers, shells, snakeskin), onto the surface of paper. Anything with a textured surface works well: fish have been used in this demonstration.
results.creator_credit_for_label: TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: From the ashes of Wednesday

results.title: What's happening to me?
results.creator_credit: Greg ingram, Stephen Smallwood, Steve Walsh and Consolidated Productions
results.brief_description: An honest, sympathetic and humorous animated presentation of the main changes occuring in females and males during puberty. Covers the growth of pubic and other body hair, menstruation, readiness for reproduction, growth of breasts, masturbation, erections, wet dreams, voice changes, pimples, different rates of onset of puberty and physical diferences between those of the same age and sex. Based on the book by Peter Mayle and Arthur Robins.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg ingram, Stephen Smallwood, Steve Walsh and Consolidated Productions
